abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            satisfactory, with the likelihood of a strong
            sustainability. The Bank's performance was also
            satisfactory, with an overall good performance by the
            borrower, despite the unfavorable macroeconomic environment
            of 1994-1995. The key lessons learned suggest that: 1)
            together with a program of structural adjustment, country
            assistance strategies should address the long-term
            infrastructure development required for a sustained economic
            growth; 2) it is possible to use a merit-based approach in
            the allocation of funds to maintain a proactive research,
            and involve the scientific community in the review process;
            3) strengthening mechanisms in science and technology should
            be considered for national developmental needs, maintaining
            excellence at the same time; 4) the uniqueness of scientific
            supplies' procurement should be taken into account when
            funding research programs; 5) the willingness to
            share/donate benefits of projects, as well as the acceptance
            of influence, should be exercised when partial control over
            resources exist; 6) incentives at the Masters/Doctoral
            levels in research grants should be strengthened; 7)
            institutional strengthening and a systemic approach in
            addressing broader technological applications are needed;
            and, 8) a high degree of stability is critical for a
            sustained institutional development.
